Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery meat-jar, the fabric is light-brown in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured burnished slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393519) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393519)
